sen.j: 一色 直氏（いっしき なおうじ（又はただうじ））は、南北朝時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Naouji ISSHIKI was a busho (Japanese military commander) during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
Naouji ISSHIKI was a busho (Japanese military commander) during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.
sen.cmt: 内容が重複するため（Japan)を削除しました。
sen.e: Naouji ISSHIKI was a busho (Japanese military commander) during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 室町幕府の第2代九州探題である。
sen.e: Naouji ISSHIKI was the second Kyushu Tandai (local commissioner) during the Muromachi Bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
Naouji ISSHIKI was the second Kyushu Tandai (local commissioner) of the Muromachi Bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: during→of に変更しました。
sen.e: Naouji ISSHIKI was the second Kyushu Tandai (local commissioner) of the Muromachi Bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 呼び名は一色孫太郎。
sen.e: Naouji ISSHIKI was commonly referred to as Magotaro ISSHIKI.
Naouji ISSHIKI was commonly referred to as Magotaro ISSHIKI.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Naouji ISSHIKI was commonly referred to as Magotaro ISSHIKI.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 法名は入道道勝。
sen.e: Naouji ISSHIKI's homyo (priest's name or posthumous Buddhist name) was Dosho NYUDO.
Naouji ISSHIKI's homyo (priest's name or posthumous Buddhist name) was Dosho NYUDO.
sen.cmt: 全角記号は半角記号に訂正しました。「道勝」：正式な読みは不明です。
sen.e: Naouji ISSHIKI's homyo (priest's name or posthumous Buddhist name) was Dosho NYUDO.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 貞和2年/正平 (日本)元年（1346年）8月、九州に下向して父・範氏から九州探題職を譲られて探題となった。
sen.e: In September of 1346, Naouji ISSHIKI left the capital and went to Kyushu, and there he was appointed to the position of Kyushu Tandai; this occurred once his father Noriuji, handed over the Tandai position to Nouji.
sen.cmt: 原文では8月とありますが、多分旧暦のことと思われますので、西暦に変換して「９月」にて訳してあります。
sen.e: In September, 1346, Naouji ISSHIKI left the capital and went to Kyushu, and there he was appointed to Kyushu Tandai, so he succeeded his father, Noriuji's position.
sen.cmt: 全体的に変更しました。（流れの修正・重複した内容の削除など）
sen.e: In September, 1346, Naouji ISSHIKI left the capital and went to Kyushu, and there he was appointed to Kyushu Tandai, so he succeeded his father, Noriuji's position.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その後は父と共に九州の経略に専念した。
sen.e: Afterwards, Naouji ISSHIKI along with his father devoted themselves to the task of ruling the Kyushu region.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Afterwards, Naouji ISSHIKI and his father devoted themselves to the task of ruling the Kyushu region.
sen.cmt: along with → and に変更しました。
sen.e: Afterwards, Naouji ISSHIKI and his father devoted themselves to the task of ruling the Kyushu region.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、九州探題としての勢力基盤は脆弱であった。
sen.e: However, the Isshiki clan lacked the basic military forces to served as Kyushu Tandai, so the power to rule was tenuous.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, the Isshiki clan lacked the basic military forces to carry out the Kyushu Tandai, so the power to rule was tenuous.
sen.cmt: carry out → served as
sen.e: However, the Isshiki clan lacked the basic military forces to carry out the Kyushu Tandai, so the power to rule was tenuous.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 原因の一つに、同じ北朝 (日本)方である元鎮西奉行少弐氏とは不仲だった事があげられる。
sen.e: One of the causes for this tenuous ruling power was the matter of the Isshiki clan being on bad terms with the Shoni clan; the Shoni clan was of the Northern Court's (Japan) side, as was the Isshiki clan; and Shoni clan used to be the chinzei bugyo (a magistrate of Kyushu region).

One of the causes for this was the matter of the Isshiki clan being on bad terms with the Shoni clan; the Shoni clan was for the Northern Court's (Japan) side, the same side of Isshiki clan and Shoni clan used to be the chinzei bugyo (a magistrate of Kyushu region).
sen.cmt: 全角記号は半角記号に訂正しました。細部を変更し、文章の流れを整えました。
sen.e: One of the causes for this was the matter of the Isshiki clan being on bad terms with the Shoni clan; the Shoni clan was for the Northern Court's (Japan) side, the same side of Isshiki clan and Shoni clan used to be the chinzei bugyo (a magistrate of Kyushu region).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 後に観応の擾乱で足利直冬を擁した少弐頼尚の攻勢を受け、一時期劣勢に立たされた。
sen.e: Later, the Isshiki clan was subjected to an offensive movement by Yorinao SHONI, who supported Tadafuyu ASHIKAGA, during the Kano Disturbance; this had the result of the Isshiki clan having to adjust to an inferior battle position for one period of time.

Later, the Isshiki clan was subjected to an offensive movement by Yorinao SHONI, who supported Tadafuyu ASHIKAGA, during the Kano Disturbance, as the result the Isshiki clan was on the back foot for a while.
sen.cmt: 文章の後半部分を変更しました。（文の流れを整えるため）
sen.e: Later, the Isshiki clan was subjected to an offensive movement by Yorinao SHONI, who supported Tadafuyu ASHIKAGA, during the Kano Disturbance, as the result the Isshiki clan was on the back foot for a while.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 直氏はのちに足利直冬を追放させることに成功する。
sen.e: Naouji would later succeed in exiling Tadafuyu ASHIKAGA from their Kyushu region.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Later Naouji succeed in exiling Tadafuyu ASHIKAGA..
sen.cmt: 余分な要素（原文にない要素）が入っていたため削除しました。
sen.e: Later Naouji succeed in exiling Tadafuyu ASHIKAGA..
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、1351年に足利尊氏が南朝 (日本)に降伏したり、北朝に征夷大将軍を解任されたりした。
sen.e: However, in 1351, Takauji ASHIKAGA surrendered to the South Court, and the Northern Court discharged the Seitaishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary forces against the barbarians, a great unifying leader) position from Takauji ASHIKAGA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, in 1351, Takauji ASHIKAGA surrendered to the South Court, and the Northern Court discharged the Seitaishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary forces against the barbarians, a great unifying leader) position from Takauji ASHIKAGA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: However, in 1351, Takauji ASHIKAGA surrendered to the South Court, and the Northern Court discharged the Seitaishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary forces against the barbarians, a great unifying leader) position from Takauji ASHIKAGA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そして、九州全土も混乱する事となる。
sen.e: Subsequently, the entire Kyushu region would be involved in chaos.
Subsequently, the entire Kyushu region was involved in chaos.
sen.cmt: would be→wasに変更しました。
sen.e: Subsequently, the entire Kyushu region was involved in chaos.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1352年に足利尊氏が北朝方へ復帰した後も、九州の大勢は徐々に南朝方に傾いていた。
sen.e: In 1352, even after Takauji ASHIKAGA had returned to the Northern Court's side, the majority of the powerful people in the Kyushu region still gradually turned to the South Court's side.
In 1352, even after Takauji ASHIKAGA had returned to the Northern Court's side, the majority of the powerful people in the Kyushu region still gradually turned to the South Court's side.
sen.cmt: 全角記号は半角記号に訂正しました。
sen.e: In 1352, even after Takauji ASHIKAGA had returned to the Northern Court's side, the majority of the powerful people in the Kyushu region still gradually turned to the South Court's side.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 直氏は文和2年/正平8年（1353年）、懐良親王を擁立する菊池武光率いる南朝軍に、筑前国針摺原の戦いで大敗を喫した。
sen.e: In 1353, Takemitsu KIKUCHI, who had supported the Imperial Prince Kaneyoshi Naouji, leading the South Court's side forces, greatly defeated Naouji during the Battle of Harisurubaru.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1353, Takemitsu KIKUCHI, who had supported the Imperial Prince Kaneyoshi, leading the South Court's side forces, greatly defeated Naouji during the Battle of Harisurubaru in Chikuzen Province.
sen.cmt: 全体的に変更しました。（訳もれ、流れの修正など）
sen.e: In 1353, Takemitsu KIKUCHI, who had supported the Imperial Prince Kaneyoshi, leading the South Court's side forces, greatly defeated Naouji during the Battle of Harisurubaru in Chikuzen Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 以後は南朝方に対して対抗できる力も失い、文和4年/正平10年（1355年）に父と共に長門国に逃亡した。
sen.e: Afterward, Naouji lost the military power with which he could oppose the South Court's side, he and his father escaped together to Nagato Province in 1355.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Afterward, Naouji lost the military power with which he could oppose the South Court's side, he and his father escaped together to Nagato Province in 1355.
sen.cmt: 全角記号は半角記号に訂正しました。
sen.e: Afterward, Naouji lost the military power with which he could oppose the South Court's side, he and his father escaped together to Nagato Province in 1355.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: このため北朝を立て直した足利尊氏の激怒を買い、翌、延文元年/正平11年（1356年）には再び九州に下向した。
sen.e: Thus, Naouji received the indignation of Takauji ASHIKAGA who had reorganized the Northern Court, and then Naouji left for the Kyushu region again the following year, in 1356.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Thus, Naouji received indignation of Takauji ASHIKAGA, who had reorganized the Northern Court, and then Naouji left for the Kyushu region again the following year, in 1356.
sen.cmt: whoの前にコンマを付けました。
sen.e: Thus, Naouji received indignation of Takauji ASHIKAGA, who had reorganized the Northern Court, and then Naouji left for the Kyushu region again the following year, in 1356.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、またも菊池軍の前に筑前麻生山の戦いで大敗を喫し、直氏は筑前という基盤を失った。
sen.e: However, once again Naouji lost the battle, suffering a great defeat by the Kikuchi military forces during the battle of the Aso-san Mountain in Chikuzen; so, he also lost his base power located within Chikuzen.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, once again Naouji lost the battle, suffering a great defeat by the Kikuchi military forces during the battle of the Aso-san Mountain in Chikuzen; so, he also lost his base located within Chikuzen.
sen.cmt: powerを削除しました。
sen.e: However, once again Naouji lost the battle, suffering a great defeat by the Kikuchi military forces during the battle of the Aso-san Mountain in Chikuzen; so, he also lost his base located within Chikuzen.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 直氏は延文3年/正平13年（1358年）に京都に逃亡している。
sen.e: In 1358, Naouji escaped to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1358, Naouji escaped to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In 1358, Naouji escaped to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: このため、足利尊氏は九州における南朝勢力の拡大を危惧して自ら親征しようとした。
sen.e: Therefore, Takauji ASHIKAGA attempted to conduct a Shinsei (military expedition led in person by the emperor) toward the Kyushu region because he was concerned about the power expansion of the South Court.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, Takauji ASHIKAGA attempted to conduct Shinsei (expedition) to the Kyushu region because he was concerned about the South Court, which was gaining power in Kyushu region.
sen.cmt: 親征の（）内説明、その他、文末を中心に変更しました。
sen.e: Therefore, Takauji ASHIKAGA attempted to conduct Shinsei (expedition) to the Kyushu region because he was concerned about the South Court, which was gaining power in Kyushu region.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、1358年、遠征直前に病死した。
sen.e: However, Takauji ASHIKAGA died from an illness prior to the expedition's campaign in 1358.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However in 1358, Takauji ASHIKAGA died just before the expedition because of illness.
sen.cmt: 全体的に変更しました。（流れの修正など）
sen.e: However in 1358, Takauji ASHIKAGA died just before the expedition because of illness.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また、新たに九州探題として任命された細川繁氏も病死した。
sen.e: Additionally, newly assigned Kyushu Tandai, Shigeuji HOSOKAWA, died from an illness.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Newly assigned Kyushu Tandai, Shigeuji HOSOKAWA, died from illness.
sen.cmt: 全体的に変更しました。（流れの修正など）
sen.e: Newly assigned Kyushu Tandai, Shigeuji HOSOKAWA, died from illness.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: まもなく少弐氏らが幕府に帰参し北朝方として新九州探題今川貞世の配下で活動するようになる。
sen.e: Soon after, the Shoni clan and other powerful people retuned to the service of the Bakufu, under the service of the Northern Court, acting as vassals of Sadayo IMAGAWA who had become the new Kyushu Tandai.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Soon after, the Shoni clan and others retuned to the Bakufu, under the service of the Northern Court, acting as vassals of Sadayo IMAGAWA, who had become the new Kyushu Tandai.
sen.cmt: 全体的に変更しました。（流れの修正など）
sen.e: Soon after, the Shoni clan and others retuned to the Bakufu, under the service of the Northern Court, acting as vassals of Sadayo IMAGAWA, who had become the new Kyushu Tandai.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 京都に逃亡後の直氏の動向は不明である。
sen.e: No one had information as to the movement of Naouji after his escape.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Ujinao's activity after running away to Kyoto is unknown.
sen.cmt: 全体的に変更しました。（流れの修正など）
sen.e: Ujinao's activity after running away to Kyoto is unknown.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そして、弟の範光が当主として活動するようになる。
sen.e: Then, Norimitsu, the younger brother of Naouji, became the family's head and carried out the family affairs.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Then, Norimitsu, the younger brother of Naouji, started to act as the family's head.
sen.cmt: 全角記号は半角記号に訂正しました。
sen.e: Then, Norimitsu, the younger brother of Naouji, started to act as the family's head.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: なお、のちに四職となった一色氏は弟の範光の系統の一族である。
sen.e: Additionally, the Isshiki clan was to later become one of the Shishiki (four prestigious clans: the Akamatsu clan, the Isshiki clan, the Kyōgoku clan, and the Yamana clan; these four clans were assigned as the superiors of the Samurai-dokoro [Board of Retainers] one by one in alternate terms during the Muromachi period) this was the lineage of the family of Norimitsu, the younger brother.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Additionally, the Isshiki clan was to later become one of the Shishiki (Four major feudal lords who worked for Muromachi bakufu) this was the lineage of the family of Norimitsu, the younger brother of Naouji.
sen.cmt: 全体的に変更しました。（文章の流れの修正など）
sen.e: Additionally, the Isshiki clan was to later become one of the Shishiki (Four major feudal lords who worked for Muromachi bakufu) this was the lineage of the family of Norimitsu, the younger brother of Naouji.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その一方、直氏の系統の一族は鎌倉公方に仕えた幸手一色氏や尾張国の丹羽氏、甲斐国の金子氏などがある。
sen.e: On the other hand, the notable lineage families of Naouji were as follows: the Satte Isshiki clan who served under the Kamakura kubo (Shogun), the Niwa clan of Owari Province, and the Kaneko clan of Kai Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Regarding the lineage of Naouji are as follows: the Satte Isshiki clan who served Kamakura kubo (Shogun), the Niwa clan of Owari Province, and the Kaneko clan of Kai Province.
